comment.author: 10702363@N06
comment._content:
The RMS Morea was one of six P&O 'M Class' passenger liners, built in 1903 at the Clydeside yard of Barclay Curle -- and generally considered to be the best-looking of her class. 

The RMS Morea was built for long distance mail services from the UK  to India and Australia and was in service from 1908 to 1930.  

In WW1, the RMS Morea was used as both as an ambulance transport and Australian Expeditionary Force troopship. 

The liner then carried out the first P&O post war passenger voyage sailing from London to Sydney via Bombay, Adelaide and Melbourne in October 1919. 

The RMS Morea was eventually sold to a company in Japan for scrap in 1930.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: That looks like Kirribilli (Sydney Harbour) in the background. More information about the RMS Morea: www.shipsnostalgia.com/guides/RMS_Morea
